refnamediv.refpurpose: validation a text field or form data

class.screen:
-- Generic Validation Class create type vspx_validator as ( vv_format varchar, vv_test varchar, vv_expr varchar, vv_message varchar, vv_empty_allowed int default 0 ) temporary self as ref ;
-- Range Validation Class create type vspx_range_validator under vspx_validator as ( vr_min any, vr_max any ) temporary self as ref method vv_validate (control vspx_control) returns any ;

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: vspx_validatorvalidator that is applied to user input. the validator objects are invoked when the element's control gets posted. the validator elements only make sense inside field or form types of controls. the validators are invoked in the order given, and the first one to fail stops the invocation chain, so that no later ones are attempted. furthermore the vc_is_valid member of the containing page class will be reset to false (0) to stop further processing. see also error-summary element and error-glyph attribute of field element.

refsect2.title: name
refsect2.para: A unique name identifying the control.

refsect2.title: initial-enable
refsect2.para: Designates is control visible or not initially. Could be data-bound to an SQL expression.

refsect2.title: test
refsect2.para: The type of test to be performed, can be 'length', 'value', 'regexp' or 'sql'. (TBD based on vspx_validators.txt)

refsect2.title: min
refsect2.para: A lower limit in value and length tests

refsect2.title: max
refsect2.para: The upper limit for value and length tests

refsect2.title: regexp
refsect2.para: The REGEXP pattern to match field value

refsect2.title: empty-allowed
refsect2.para: If specified as true (1) this will allow submitting a empty fields

refsect2.title: message
refsect2.para: The error-message to be shown when validation process fails

example.title: Simple example
example.para: This is to validate a text area input
example.screen: <v:textarea name="ta1" default="enter your text here" value="--coalesce ({?'ta1'}, control.ufl_value)"> <v:validator test="length" min="0" max="50" message="50 chars at max." /> </v:textarea>
